comments:
I downloaded the F1 build and tried running it on a workspace I had been
using with M5. Everytime I ran Eclipse I would get "Completing install" and
it would quit. I deleted the .config directory as some posts in this group
suggested, but the popup continues to come up each time I launch eclipse and
then terminate.

I also tried doing this with a new workspace... Same behavior.

I have zipped up the .config directories and they are located at:

// Created when there wasnt a workspace and eclipse was run...
http://www.binary.net/iii/dot.config.new.zip
// The same .config directory after Eclipse was run for the second time.
http://www.binary.net/iii/dot.config.after1run.zip

Command line used to run Eclipse was:
C:\apps\eclipse\eclipse.exe -vm C:\apps\j2sdk1.4.0\bin\javaw.exe

I don't seem to be able to download the files (download but appear empty). 
Could you please attach them directly to the defect in Bugzilla (use 
the "Create a new attachment" link below the "Keywords" field, and set the file 
type as binary.  

Thanks.
Upon closer inspection, the directory remains empty throughout each run.

We saw a post on the newsgroup about possible permission problems. Did this fix 
things for you or does the problem persist. We are having problems recreating 
this.

It doesn't appear to be a permision problem (atleast by looking at the 
properties tab for the .config folder). The .config directory is created by 
eclipse when it is run the first time (when the workspace directory is 
created), so I would assume that since Eclipse created it, it could also 
read/write to it. 

I did notice after each time I run Eclipse I get the following in the log, but 
this is probably caused by Eclipse quiting after the "Completing install" 
message is displayed?

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 May 24, 2002 11:54:07.637
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke
(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:200)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:643)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:476)
Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: loaderStartup
	at java.lang.Class.getMethod0(Class.java:1742)
	at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethod(Class.java:1219)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup
(InternalBootLoader.java:870)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run
(InternalBootLoader.java:732)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:462)
	... 7 more
Deleting my entire eclipse tree and reextracting f1 over it fixed the problem.
